intro: Beckera nubica, commonly known as the Ethiopian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Beckera nubica is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its striking floral display.
